title: 109_hr3673
content:
Appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005, include funds for Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide under the Department of Defense-Military. $1.4 billion is allocated for emergency hurricane expenses under "Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide". The Secretary of Defense can transfer these funds to various military appropriations. An additional $6 million can be transferred to the "Armed Forces Retirement Home". The transferred funds will be available for the same purposes and time period as the original appropriation. This transfer authority is in addition to any other available to the Department. The Secretary of Defense can transfer funds from the $1.4 billion allocated for emergency hurricane expenses to various military appropriations. Any excess funds can be transferred back to the original appropriation within 5 days. The amounts provided are designated as an emergency requirement. The Department of Defense - Civil, Department of the Army, Corps of Engineers - Civil, allocates $200,000,000 for emergency expenses to repair storm damage in Gulf states affected by Hurricane Katrina. The Chief of Engineers will provide weekly reports on fund allocation starting September 15, 2005. The amount is designated as an emergency requirement under section 402 of H. Con. Res. 95 (109th Congress). The Department of Homeland Security allocates $200,000,000 for emergency expenses to repair flood control and hurricane shore protection projects in Gulf states affected by Hurricane Katrina. The Chief of Engineers will provide weekly reports on fund allocation starting September 15, 2005. EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE - Disaster Relief (INCLUDING TRANSFERS OF FUNDS) $50,000,000,000 is allocated for Disaster Relief, with $100,000,000 potentially transferred to National Disaster Medical System. $15,000,000 is designated for the Office of Inspector General for audits related to Hurricane Katrina. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide weekly reports on fund allocation. The funds allocated for Disaster Relief are designated as an emergency requirement and must be obligated by September 15, 2005. GENERAL PROVISION

Sec. 101. Emergency procurement authority can be used for Hurricane Katrina rescue and relief operations. The procurement amount specified shall be $250,000. This Act is titled the "Second Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act to Meet Immediate Needs Arising From the Consequences of Hurricane Katrina, 2005".
